intro: Heterotropa arifolia, commonly known as the lace-leaf fern, is a tropical plant characterized by its delicate, feathery fronds. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is native to Southeast Asia. The plant features intricate, lacy foliage with slender, arching leaves that give it a graceful appearance. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-drained, moist soil. Its unique morphology makes it a popular choice for ornamental gardening and indoor plant collections.
